channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Afghanistan war: Sheberghan falls to Taliban, militants say
item.description: Sheberghan in the northern province of Jawzjan is the second regional capital to fall to the Taliban.

item.title: Greece wildfires spread, causing mass evacuations
item.description: Thousands of people are evacuated north of the capital, Athens, as fires continue to rage.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: German pentathlon coach thrown out for punching horse
item.description: A German coach who appeared to strike a horse with her fist during the modern pentathlon is thrown out of the Olympics.

item.title: Capitol riot: Off-duty Seattle police officers fired over assault
item.description: The officers stood by as Donald Trump's supporters stormed the government building, an inquiry says.

item.title: Bat killed by cat after record 1,200-mile journey
item.description: A record-breaking bat - the size of a human thumb - is discovered in Russia after flying from London.

item.title: Larry Page: Google co-founder granted New Zealand residency
item.description: The country's immigration services say he applied under a category for wealthy investors.

item.title: Famous Central Park owl killed in crash with van
item.description: Barry the beloved owl was hit by a maintenance vehicle in the park while searching for food.

item.title: Mercer Street: Tanker blast evidence points to Iran, says US
item.description: The attack on the Israeli-operated merchant tanker last week killed two people.

item.title: Tokyo attack: Knife-wielding man injures 10 on train
item.description: The suspect allegedly told police he was angry when he saw women who "looked happy".

item.title: Apple criticised for system that detects child abuse
item.description: There are privacy concerns that the system will be expanded to scan phones for political speech.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Olympic athletes struggle with heat at Games
item.description: This games are one of the warmest on record, with many athletes complaining about the high temperatures.

item.title: Two arrested over plot to kill Myanmar UN ambassador
item.description: Ambassador Kyaw Moe Tun is a vocal critic of Myanmar's junta, which seized power in a coup on 1 February.

item.title: China says no more Mao badges after IOC warning
item.description: The Olympic body says it has been told Chinese athletes will no longer wear badges seen as political.

item.title: Belarus crackdown fails to crush opposition spirit
item.description: Beaten up, jailed, forced into exile - protesters are still battling against President Lukashenko.

item.title: Mayflower 400 years: How many people are related to the Mayflower pilgrims?
item.description: For some, the17th century "pilgrim fathers" are also real-life ancestors. But for how many?

item.title: 'We want trillions to heal our wounds'
item.description: Descendants of victims of Germany's atrocities in Namibia say the money offered is not nearly enough.

item.title: Climate change: New report will highlight 'stark reality' of warming
item.description: The IPCC's short scientific summary due out on Monday will be strongest statement yet on climate change.

item.title: Eurovision, Euro 2020 and Tokyo 2020 Olympics - Italy's golden summer
item.description: "This is Italy's moment of glory" - after Eurovision & Euro 2020 victories, an Italian Wimbledon finalist, now comes Olympics history in Tokyo.

item.title: Week in pictures: 31 July - 6 August 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Greece fires: Hundreds rescued by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard moved 650 people from Limni, in the north of the island of Evia.

item.title: Tokyo attack: Women targeted 'for looking happy'
item.description: A female student is said to be seriously injured, while the others suffered less severe injuries.

item.title: Afghan interpreter: 'A better life for my wife and children in the UK'
item.description: Afghan interpreters who worked with British forces are being relocated to the UK, as the Taliban advance.

item.title: ICYMI: Surfing, an Olympic maze and a sheep stampede
item.description: Some of the stories you may have missed this week.

item.title: Telfar Clemens: Designer creates Tokyo 2020 Olympic outfits for Team Liberia
item.description: American-Liberian designer Telfar Clemens created Liberian team's outfits at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: India wins first athletics gold in men's javelin
item.description: India has now won seven medals at Tokyo - one gold, two silver and four bronze, its biggest Olympic haul ever.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Japan beat US to win first Olympic baseball gold medal
item.description: An elated Japanese side won the coveted Olympic baseball gold at Tokyo 2020 after beating the United States on Saturday.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Brazil defend men's football title with win over Spain
item.description: Brazil defend their Olympic men's football title following a dramatic extra-time victory over Spain.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Israel's Linoy Ashram ends Russian dominance in rhythmic gymnastics
item.description: Israel's Linoy Ashram caused a huge upset in the Olympic rhythmic gymnastics individual all-around final, becoming the first non-Russian champion since 1996.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: USA's Nelly Korda wins gold on dramatic final day of golf competition
item.description: American Nelly Korda wins gold on a dramatic final day in the women's Olympic golf.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Kenya's Peres Jepchirchir wins women's marathon
item.description: Peres Jepchirchir wins the women's marathon at Tokyo 2020 as Kenya claim a one-two in sweltering 28C heat in Japan's northern city of Sapporo.
